name: Nauru
introduction: The exact origins of the Nauruans are unclear since their language does not resemble any other in the Pacific region. Germany annexed the island in 1888. A German-British consortium began mining the island's phosphate deposits early in the 20th century. Australian forces occupied Nauru in World War I; it subsequently became a League of Nations mandate. After the Second World War - and a brutal occupation by Japan - Nauru became a UN trust territory. It achieved independence in 1968 and joined the UN in 1999 as the world's smallest independent republic.

communications.phone_system_general_assessment: adequate local and international radiotelephone communication provided via Australian facilities
communications.phone_system_international: country code - 674; satellite earth station - 1 Intelsat (Pacific Ocean)
communications.broadcast_media: 1 government-owned TV station broadcasting programs from New Zealand sent via satellite or on videotape; 1 government-owned radio station, broadcasting on AM and FM, utilizes Australian and British programs (2009)

economy.overview: Revenues of this tiny island - a coral atoll with a land area of 21 square kilometers - traditionally have come from exports of phosphates. Few other resources exist, with most necessities being imported, mainly from Australia, its former occupier and later major source of support. Primary reserves of phosphates were exhausted and mining ceased in 2006, but mining of a deeper layer of "secondary phosphate" in the interior of the island began the following year. The secondary phosphate deposits may last another 30 years. Earnings from Nauruâ€™s export of phosphate remains an important source of income. Few comprehensive statistics on the Nauru economy exist; estimates of Nauru's GDP vary widely. ++  ++ The rehabilitation of mined land and the replacement of income from phosphates are serious long-term problems. In anticipation of the exhaustion of Nauru's phosphate deposits, substantial amounts of phosphate income were invested in trust funds to help cushion the transition and provide for Nauru's economic future. ++  ++ Although revenue sources for government are limited, the opening of the Australian Regional Processing Center for asylum seekers since 2012 has sparked growth in the economy. Revenue derived from fishing licenses under the "vessel day scheme" has also boosted government income. Housing, hospitals, and other capital plant are deteriorating. The cost to Australia of keeping the government and economy afloat continues to climb.
economy.gdp_power_parity: $150.8 million (2015 est.) ++ $139.7 million (2014 est.) ++ $127 million (2013 est.)
economy.industries: phosphate mining, offshore banking, coconut products
economy.labor_force_occupation_notes: most of the labor force is employed in phosphate mining, public administration, education, and transportation
economy.imports_commodities: food, fuel, manufactures, building materials, machinery

geography.location_description: Oceania, island in the South Pacific Ocean, south of the Marshall Islands
geography.area_note: about 0.1 times the size of Washington, DC
geography.climate: tropical with a monsoonal pattern; rainy season (November to February)
geography.terrain: sandy beach rises to fertile ring around raised coral reefs with phosphate plateau in center
geography.notes: world's smallest island country; situated just 53 km south of the Equator; Nauru is one of the three great phosphate rock islands in the Pacific Ocean - the others are Banaba (Ocean Island) in Kiribati and Makatea in French Polynesia

government.name: Republic of Nauru
government.name_etymology: the island name may derive from the Nauruan word "anaoero" meaning "I go to the beach"
government.capital_time_zone: UTC+12 (17 hours ahead of Washington, DC, during Standard Time)
government.administrative_divisions: 14 districts; Aiwo, Anabar, Anetan, Anibare, Baiti, Boe, Buada, Denigomodu, Ewa, Ijuw, Meneng, Nibok, Uaboe, Yaren
government.independence: 31 January 1968 (from the Australia-, NZ-, and UK-administered UN trusteeship)
government.legal_system: mixed legal system of common law based on the English model and customary law
government.suffrage: 20 years of age; universal and compulsory
government.executive_chief_of_state: President Baron WAQA (since 11 June 2013); note - the president is both chief of state and head of government
government.executive_cabinet: Cabinet appointed by the president from among members of Parliament
government.executive_elections: president indirectly elected by Parliament for a 3-year renewable term; election last held on 11 June 2013 (next to be held in 2016)
government.executive_election_results: Baron WAQA reelected president on 11 June 2013; Parliament vote - Baron WAQA (independent) 13, Roland KUN (Nauru First)  5
government.legislative_description: unicameral parliament (19 seats; members directly elected in multi-seat constituencies by majority vote; members serve 3-year terms)
government.legislative_elections: last held on 9 July 2016 (next to be held in 2019)
government.legislative_election_results: percent of vote - NA; seats - independent 19
government.legislative_highest_courts: Supreme Court (consists of a chief justice and 1 judge)
government.legislative_judge_selection: judges appointed by the president to serve until age 65
government.political_parties: Democratic Party [Kennan ADEANG] ++ Nauru First (Naoero Amo) Party ++ Nauru Party (informal)
government.international_organization_participation: ACP, ADB, AOSIS, C, FAO, G-77, ICAO, ICCt, IFAD, Interpol, IOC, IOM, ITU, OPCW, PIF, Sparteca, SPC, UN, UNCTAD, UNESCO, UPU, WHO
government.diplomatic_representation_from_usa: the US does not have an embassy in Nauru; the US Ambassador to Fiji is accredited to Nauru
government.flag_description: blue with a narrow, horizontal, yellow stripe across the center and a large white 12-pointed star below the stripe on the hoist side; blue stands for the Pacific Ocean, the star indicates the country's location in relation to the Equator (the yellow stripe) and the 12 points symbolize the 12 original tribes of Nauru
government.national_symbols: frigatebird, calophyllum flower; national colors: blue, yellow, white
